page.title: 11Templehall Library,Kirkcaldy
page.content: The library is a modern building staffed by four full-time and three part-time librarians.To become a librarian you must have a University degree and a Diploma from the Library Association.Librarians are paid between Â£4000 and Â£10000 a year depending on their years of service. There are about 30000 books in all, one third children's and the rest adults'.There are 12000 fiction and 180 reference books.There are 4517 members of the library. If an adult book is overdue a 10p fine is paid for every week but children are given an extra three months, a reminder is issued and they have to pay the postage.At week-ends and in holidays competitions are held to write poems, design bookmarks etc . Storytimes are held for children to listen to readings and meet famous authors.
